jx.jx_en_mean: To sign in, as at a place of business, by use of a magnetic card.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 签到：如在商业场所用磁卡所进行的登记

jx.jx_cn_mean: 签退：用磁卡登记姓名以示离开，如离开商业活动的场所时

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit.)a plan or asset that is kept secret until it is needed
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英)必要时才公开的计划（或优势）；锦囊妙计

jx.jx_en_mean: be in a very strong or advantageous position
jx.jx_cn_mean: 处于非常强势（或有利）的位置

lj.lj_ly: our marriage has been on the cards from day one.
lj.lj_ls: 我们从一开始就有结婚的可能。

jx.jx_en_mean: exploit the specified issue or idea mentioned, especially for political advantage
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指为政治利益而）利用某问题（或观点），打…牌

lj.lj_ly: he saw an opportunity to play the peace card.
lj.lj_ls: 他看到了一次打和平牌的机会。

jx.jx_en_mean: make the best use of one's assets and opportunities

phrase.cizu_name: put (或 lay) one's cards on the table

jx.jx_en_mean: be completely open and honest in declaring one's resources, intentions, or attitude
jx.jx_cn_mean: 坦陈（某人的办法、意图或态度），摊牌

jx.jx_en_mean: A secret resource or plan held in reserve
jx.jx_cn_mean: 有锦囊妙计：有所保留的，秘而不宣的谋略或计划

lj.lj_ly: a tough negotiator who had a number of cards up his sleeve.
lj.lj_ls: 一个拥有很多锦囊妙计的难以对付的谈判者

jx.jx_cn_mean: 很可能或一定会发生的

lj.lj_ly: My promotion to a higher position just isn't in the cards.
lj.lj_ls: 我的职位很可能不会提升了

jx.jx_en_mean: To make frank and clear revelation, as of one's motives or intentions.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 摊牌：把自己的动机或意图坦白明了地公布出来

phrase.cizu_name: put (one's) cards on the table 或 lay (one's) cards on the table

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in sense 3 of the noun): from Old French carte, from Latin carta, charta, from Greek khartēs 'papyrus leaf'
late Middle English: from Old French carde, from Provençal carda, from cardar 'tease, comb', based on Latin carere 'to card'

encyclopedia.content: 相关词语和程序 1. 纸牌[C] 2. 纸牌游戏[P] 3. 卡片；名片；请帖[C] 4. 明信片[C] 5. 硬纸板[U] 6. 【口】引人发笑的人；怪人[C] 7. 办法，手段，妙计[C] 8. (运动会等的)节目单[C 9.在集合“容斥原理”中： 在研究集合时，会遇到有关集合中的元素个数问题，我们把有限集合A的元素个数记为card(A)。例如A={a,b,c}，则card(A)=3候选路由发现机制缩写 Candidate Access Router Discovery的缩写，候选路由发现机制。研究院简称 浙江

entry.def: A card is a piece of stiff paper or thin cardboard on which something is written or printed.

example.ex: Check the numbers below against the numbers on your card.
example.tran: 把下列数字和你卡片上的数字比照一下。

entry.def: A card is a piece of cardboard or plastic, or a small document, which shows information about you and which you carry with you, for example to prove your identity.

example.ex: They check my bag and press card.
example.tran: 他们检查我的包和记者证。

example.ex: ...her membership card...
example.tran: 她的会员证

entry.tran: 银行卡;借记卡;工资卡;购物卡
entry.def: A card is a rectangular piece of plastic, issued by a bank, company, or shop, which you can use to buy things or obtain money.

example.ex: He paid the whole bill with an American Express card...
example.tran: 他用美国运通卡付了全部账款。

example.ex: Holidaymakers should beware of using plastic cards in foreign cash dispensers.
example.tran: 外出度假时,在外币取款机上使用银行卡一定要小心。

entry.def: A card is a folded piece of stiff paper with a picture and sometimes a message printed on it, which you send to someone on a special occasion.

example.ex: She sends me a card on my birthday.
example.tran: 我过生日时她寄来一张贺卡。

example.ex: ...millions of get-well cards.
example.tran: 数百万张祝愿康复的卡片

entry.def: A card is the same as a postcard .

example.ex: Send your details on a card to the following address.
example.tran: 在明信片上写明你的近况寄到下面的地址。

entry.def: A card is a piece of thin cardboard carried by someone such as a business person in order to give to other people. A card shows the name, address, telephone number, and other details of the person who carries it.

example.ex: Here's my card. You may need me.
example.tran: 这是我的名片,你也许会用得到我。

entry.def: Cards are thin pieces of cardboard with numbers or pictures printed on them which are used to play various games.

example.ex: ...a pack of cards...
example.tran: 一副扑克牌

example.ex: Kurt picked up his hand and fanned out the cards one by one.
example.tran: 库尔特拿起他那手牌,一张张成扇形铺开。

entry.def: If you are playing cards, you are playing a game using cards.

example.ex: They enjoy themselves drinking wine, smoking and playing cards.
example.tran: 他们又是喝酒抽烟,又是打牌,玩得很痛快。

entry.def: You can use card to refer to something that gives you an advantage in a particular situation. If you play a particular card, you use that advantage.

example.ex: It was his strongest card in their relationship — that she wanted him more than he wanted her...
example.tran: 在他俩的爱情关系中,他的最大优势是:她需要他超过他需要她。

example.ex: This permitted Western manufacturers to play their strong cards: capital and technology.
example.tran: 这让西方制造商得以亮出他们的王牌:资金和技术。

entry.def: Card is strong, stiff paper or thin cardboard.

example.ex: She put the pieces of card in her pocket.
example.tran: 她把那些硬纸片放进了口袋。

entry.def: In computing, a card is a circuit board that can be put into a computer to provide additional memory or functions.

entry.tran: (体育比赛的)赛事安排，比赛日程
entry.def: You can use card to refer to a series of races or matches at a particular sporting event.

example.ex: Paradise Boy and the Galloping General have clear chances in the opening two events on the card...
example.tran: “天堂男孩”和“飞奔将军”这两匹赛马在开赛的前两场胜算很大。

example.ex: He will now fight Kevin Ford on the five-bout card.
example.tran: 他将在五局制比赛中迎战凯文·福特。

entry.tran: 要求…出示证明文件(表明达到买酒或饮酒的年龄等)
entry.def: If you are carded, someone in authority asks you to show a document to prove that you are old enough to do something, for example, to buy or drink alcohol.

example.ex: For the first time in many years, I got carded.
example.tran: 这么多年来，头一回有人要我出示身份证。

entry.def: If you say that something is on the cards in British English, or in the cards in American English, you mean that it is very likely to happen.

example.ex: Last summer she began telling friends that a New Year marriage was on the cards.
example.tran: 去年夏天,她就和朋友们说她有可能在元旦期间结婚。

entry.tran: 处理得当;巧妙发挥优势
entry.def: If you say that someone will achieve success if they play their cards right, you mean that they will achieve success if they act skilfully and use the advantages that they have.

example.ex: He could even be the next manager of the England team if he plays his cards right.
example.tran: 如果他处理得好,说不定都能当上英格兰队的下任教练。

entry.tran: 摊牌;直抒己见;和盘托出(感觉、想法、计划)
entry.def: If you put or lay your cards on the table, you deal with a situation by speaking openly about your feelings, ideas, or plans.

example.ex: Put your cards on the table and be very clear about your complaints.
example.tran: 你有话就直说,有什么不满都说清楚。

means.word_mean: 1. one of a set of small pieces of stiff paper marked in various ways and used for playing games or for telling fortunes;

sentences.sentence: "he collected cards and traded them with the other boys"

means.word_mean: 2. a card certifying the identity of the bearer;

sentences.sentence: "he had to show his card to get in"

means.word_mean: 3. a rectangular piece of stiff paper used to send messages (may have printed greetings or pictures);

sentences.sentence: "they sent us a card from Miami"

means.word_mean: 5. a witty amusing person who makes jokes
6. a sign posted in a public place as an advertisement;
7. a printed or written greeting that is left to indicate that you have visited
8. (golf) a record of scores (as in golf);

sentences.sentence: "you have to turn in your card to get a handicap"

means.word_mean: 9. a list of dishes available at a restaurant;
10. (baseball) a list of batters in the order in which they will bat;

sentences.sentence: "the managers presented their cards to the umpire at home plate"

means.word_mean: 11. a printed circuit that can be inserted into expansion slots in a computer to increase the computer's capabilities
2. ask someone for identification to determine whether he or she is old enough to consume liquor;

sentences.sentence: "I was carded when I tried to buy a beer!"

It's great because we play cards or just sit around and talk when there are no customers.

sentences.en: The cards are arranged by author and subject.
sentences.cn: 书卡按作者和科目排列。

jushi.english: He fanned out the cards in his hand.
jushi.chinese: 他把手中的纸牌呈扇形展开。

jushi.english: The child tried to build a house of cards but it soon fell over.
jushi.chinese: 这孩子试着用牌搭一所房子,可是它一会儿就倒坍了。

jushi.english: I contrasted Fair's report card with Dan's to show him how poorly he was doing.
jushi.chinese: 我把费尔的成绩单同丹的做一对比,以示他的成绩多么坏。
